Reviews.Title: “perfect hotel to stay in at the Gaslamp district”
Reviews.Author: seemorebeauty
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Marriott Gaslamp could not have been more pleasant. We actually arrived about an hour and a half before check in and they gave us our room early. Check in was very pleasant as were all the employees at the hotel. The concierge was fabulous, getting us dinner reservations and tickets to the san diego zoo. The hotel has a fun rooftop bar that overlooks the stadium. The only thing that was lacking was the service in the restaurant. I would definitely stay here again, it is close to everything and we didn't even need a rental car.

Reviews.Title: “MARRIOTT GASLAMP QUARTER”
Reviews.Author: slong9
Reviews.Content: Very nice facility, excellent service from the staff. Restaurant is great, too. Loved the comfortable bed and linens, as well as high quality toiletries.

Reviews.Title: “great location, awesome rooftop bar, lovely staff”
Reviews.Author: srt920
Reviews.Content: This was the first time staying at this Marriott in the Gaslamp district and it was by far my favorite hotel. Easy access to everything, including the convention center. Great rooftop bar with awesome views. Rooms were very comfortable and I especially enjoyed picking up a few tootsie rolls at the end of the day on my way up to my room. Thanks to the GM for having big bowls of his favorite candy for the taking. Staff was very pleasant and helpful. This would be my hotel of choice in the future. Only drawback was charging for internet access.

Reviews.Title: “This is an attractive Hotel with modern updates and friendly service.”
Reviews.Author: EWWilson
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Marriott Gaslamp while attending a conferece held at the San Diego Convntion Center. The hotel is a short two block walk to the Convention Center, and is also a short walk away from the center of San Diego's Gaslamp District, where there are innumerable restaurants, bars, shops, and clubs to attract both young and old. The top floor of the hotel has an open air club that was jumping most nights, and from which one has a great view of the inside of Petco Field where the Padres play.

Reviews.Title: “Good return visit to well located Marriott”
Reviews.Author: South_Pasadena_1
Reviews.Content: Return visit to a San Diego hotel that I stayed in over a year ago. Very well located in San Diego and convenient to walk to from the Gaslamp trolley stop (and convenient from Amtrak via the trolley). Nice rooms on the smaller side, although a little dated with no flat screen TVs. Generally quiet even though activity in hotel. Restaurant is attractive with good food and presentation, although frankly there's lots of alternatives within a few blocks. Nice touch is free bowls of candy (including Necco wafers!) at check-in desk in lobby. Surprisingly for 2010, they charge for internet access in a hotel that's trying to be business friendy (even for Marriott elite members).

Reviews.Title: “Time and again--I will be come back anytime I am in San Diego!”
Reviews.Author: Samdog13
Reviews.Content: I hated to leave this hotel. Staying for 5 nights, I was indeed an honored guest. My business days were rewarded by coming back to a wonerful, relaxing environment. All staff members made me feel at home and went above and beyond to make my stay with them a positive, memorable occassion. The complimentary bowls of goodies at the front desk was an added bonus! I want to move in! .

Reviews.Title: “Oh wow. I want to LIVE in this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Carrie P
Reviews.Content: We were only in San Diego for one night and it was very much a "race from the airport, sleep, race back to the airport" trip without much chance to do anything else, but the hotel really elevated this from a stopover to a really enjoyable experience. It's one of the nicest hotels I've stayed at recently. I was very impressed with the room. Everything seemed just a touch above the usual quality you'd expect at this price level. We were on the 16th floor in a room very close to the elevators but didn't notice any noise. The bathroom was beautifully designed. They really made perfect use of a rather small area, with lovely tile walls and floor, and the bathroom amenities included fluffy sponges and bath gel in addition to the usual shampoo, conditioner, lotion, soap set. Very impressive. We didn't eat at the hotel (except for snagging Tootsie Rolls and taffy from the big bowls at the reception desk every time we went in or out) but had a big room service breakfast which was well worth the $18 each that it cost. Again, very impressive, and a good value considering this was not at all something that just got scraped out of a can or a cereal box. I like their late checkout time (noon) and we were also impressed that when we checked out, our car was already waiting for us at the valet stand without having to ask for it. The location is excellent, right in the Gaslamp Quarter so there are about a hundred restaurants of every imaginable type within a few minutes' walk. It was wasted on us because we didn't have time for much, but I would love to go back and stay for a proper visit to the area. Sitting in a nice room having this amazing breakfast, we joked that the ideal thing would be to move in permanently. It only counted as a joke because we haven't won the lottery yet, but as soon as we do... yeah, pretty serious about the idea.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location to Gaslamp and water front”
Reviews.Author: joseph_h_lancaster
Reviews.Content: Great service and the room was great. The staff was great and went out of their way to make our stay perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Best location at a resonable price”
Reviews.Author: smo8
Reviews.Content: This place is across the street from the ball park. I was on the 9th floor and I could see 70% of the stadium minus the game it self. The area obviously has a healthy night life because of the ball park, however in the morning families brought their kids, yes children, to walk and play in the park. The restaurants and eateries are from $ to $$$. Anyone going to San Diego for the first time like me, the distance from K street (where the hotel is located) to Market street is a ten minutes walk that will feel like five minutes because there are so many shops and restaurants you will walk by. Regarding the hotel, well it is Marriott. You need not worry about quality, cleanlyness, security, attention to details etc. just enjoy.

Reviews.Title: “WOW!”
Reviews.Author: Jazy91
Reviews.Content: I am a frequent traveler and very loyal to Marriott, and I must say that this hotel is definitely one of my top 5 in the world. With the Altitude Lounge on the roof, this hotel is perfect! The staff was extremely friendly and helpful. I would recommend this hotel for anyone!!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Marriott, really should be a JW”
Reviews.Author: lucycan
Reviews.Content: Im a Platinum and stay at a LOT of Marriott properties around the world each year. This is one of the nicer ones, that is for sure. It is really JW level (upscale from the "regular" Marriott brand) compared to other Marriotts. PROS: Friendly staff Great concierge lounge Comfy bed Nice bathroom Excellent location Rooftop bar CONS: Less than average liquor selection at the main bar Had to ask to take Wired for Business charges off the bill - ALL other Marriotts do this automatically

Reviews.Title: “Standard quality. Good Location”
Reviews.Author: nameover
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my girlfriend in August 2010. We were only spending an night in San Diego so we needed a hotel that was well located. The hotel is very well located near the historic Gas Lamp Quarter. You are about a 5 minute walk away from all the nightlife buzz. The Marriott was a bit more expensive than other alternatives nearby but we decided to pay the extra mile to ensure a quality standard. The hotel is a typical Marriott hotel. Not much to say here. Comfortable beds, nice rooms and service.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome - Go Giants”
Reviews.Author: sfgfan
Reviews.Content: Got the room thru Orbitz which was $100 cheaper than hotel quote. Came to see the Giants beat the Padres which they did. Can't beat the location which was across the street from Petco Park and we were able to watch batting practice before walking across the street to the game. Altitude bar is the place to go before and after the game. Best Bartenders in town. Don't valet park. Park across the street and if you don't plan on moving your car for a few days just pay the lost ticket price of $17.00 instead of the $64.00 it would cost to valet.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Comfortable, and Convienent - great gym, great breakfast, and great view!”
Reviews.Author: FussyNewEnglander
Reviews.Content: I visit a client in San Diego annually and decided to switch things up a bit and try out the San Diego Marriott Gaslamp Quarter hotel rather than the usual Downtown Courtyard Marriott. I am very pleased with my decision- the location is great and I had a view of both the water and the ball park from my room. The gym is on the 22nd floor and is much better than most Marriott gyms (more equipment and better space) - with individual flat screens for the aerobic equipment as well as nice big windows if you prefer to look at the cityscape rather than watch tv while you work out. In addition, the bed was gloriously comfortable and the breakfast was probably the best Marriott breakfast I have ever had (and I have had a lot of Marriott breakfasts). I will definitely return to this hotel for future San Diego business trips!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location, great value”
Reviews.Author: jlee2008
Reviews.Content: This Marriott surprised me in that it was very modern and stylish, but not overly so (like the Se hotel in San Diego). The rooms are a good size and modern, but warm, and everything about it was right: outlets easily available, little noise, nice bathroom amenities, comfortable bed, large desk, comfortable chair and ottoman, etc. I was here for business so I just wanted a large comfortable bed and low noise, and I got that. The staff was friendly and nice too. This is one of the better Marriott hotels I have stayed at in terms of having a nice, clean, modern and comfortable room. In addition, the location is great, near Petco Park and all of the shops and restaurants in the Gaslamp quarter. The value was good too $149 per night. The Residence Inn across the street looks nice too, but slightly more expensive (about $189).

Reviews.Title: “I wouldn't stay here again”
Reviews.Author: coconut90
Reviews.Content: For such an upscale and pricey hotel, it was a big hassle to do most everything. The room was excellent and very quiet, waiting for an elevator was insane. I do not travel much and I was shocked at the required deposit to stay one night also. That information should have been told to me ahead of time so I was prepared.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location, great food, great service, can't wait until next time”
Reviews.Author: DonR54
Reviews.Content: This is a quality hotel that goes above and beyond for service and amenities. Literally walking distance from Petco Park, the convention center and the entire gvaslamp quarter it is the perfect hotel for both business and leisure travelers.

Reviews.Title: “Always a great stay!”
Reviews.Author: jsn_10
Reviews.Content: This hotel is great. Each time I have been greeted by friendly valets and friendly front desk staff. The treats at the front counter are fun. The rooms are clean and the amenities are first class. The area around the hotel is great for walking and sightseeing. This is my favorite San Diego hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel for Gaslamp Partiers”
Reviews.Author: Salthawk
Reviews.Content: This hotel would be superb for fans of the San Diego Gaslamp Quarter and is right across street from Petco Park. Rooms not new but well appointed and very clean. Desk chair needed to be replaced - very worn. Staff friendly. Starbucks Coffee in room and a good on-site restaurant. Can be a little noisy at night with Gaslamp partiers in street. Make sure to ask for a room on high floor with view of bay. We got a good deal through AAA which included breakfast, parking and gas card.

Reviews.Title: “WE LOOOOVEEE IT HERE”
Reviews.Author: twdenise
Reviews.Content: This place was perfect for a Valentine's day weekend! The rooftop lounge is sexy and fun, the room was clean, comfortable, and trendy, the bathroom amenities were fabulous (fiance still raving!), and it was in close proximity of everything there is to do in downtown SD! Walked from our hotel to breakfast and the beach! Also took a carriage ride to local restaurants for dinner and a quick cab to Coronado for dinner one night...we definitely plan on staying here again!!

Reviews.Title: “TEF Workshop”
Reviews.Author: RoRo072
Reviews.Content: The service was excellent because me and the contact stayed in touch and she made sure everything was perfect. The whole staff there were very courteous and professional. The rooms wasclean and even the housekeeper wil come by at night to make sure eveything has been taken care of.

Reviews.Title: “Petco Park, Fabulous Room, Great Room Service = Spectacular Mini-Vacation”
Reviews.Author: emacv
Reviews.Content: Every summer we take our grandchildren to a Padre game and stay at a downtown San Diego hotel. This year the children (13 and 16) chose the Marriott Gaslamp Quarter. It is now our favorite hotel! We loved walking across the street to the ballpark, our rooms on the concierge floor were spacious and lovely, and the beds very comfortable. We never heard a sound from other rooms. We elected to have room service for breakfast and it was delicious and served on time. All the products offered are great and my granddaughter and I were in heaven trying everything.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay, must-see rooftop lounge”
Reviews.Author: hendrihill
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for one night (July 27-28) with a couple of friends. Outstanding location, and very pleased with the room, which was spacious clean, comfortable and offered a nice view. Very nice bathroom as well - good water pressure. Parking's a bit pricey ($27/night), but there's a public parking lot a half block south (on 6th Ave, between K St and L St) that's a bit cheaper, and offers elevators for easy access to the street level. The front desk staff was pleasant. Altitude, the rooftop lounge located on the 22nd floor, is a *must-see*. Going there for a drink around sunset highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome!”
Reviews.Author: Shigo28
Reviews.Content: The location is great and the staff at Gaslamp Quarter is awesome! The staff is very friendly and extremely helpful. Prior to our stay I requested some extra items from the concierge, when we arrived, everything I requested was in our room. We had a fabulous time at the Altitude later that evening, again staff was supurb! I am a Marriott rewards member and have been to several Marriotts and hotels affiliated with the Marriott and by far this one has the best customer service!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Room and Excellent Service!!”
Reviews.Author: dextra55
Reviews.Content: While at first I thought this was a little pricy, once I went into the hotel I realized what a great deal it was. The service was great from the get go -- I was greeted warmly by the staff and had a seamless check in at the front desk. The chic style of the lobby is reminiscent of a much more expensive boutique hotel especially with the beautiful glass figurines on one side of the room. The room was clean, and the bathroom was spacious and spotless - a trait I am quite fussy about. The bed was very comfortable for perfect nights of sleep. The free internet and fitness center were a great plus, too. As for the location, it couldn't be better. I took full advantage of the proximity to San Diego's convention center by previewing the legendary Comicon today. The gaslamp district is a vibrant, bustling part of town. It was also especially nice to be able to relax at the hotel at the end of a long day. The soleil restaurant had amazing food and for breakfast you can sit on a closed off area outside by the side walk. It was the perfect way to start the day. All in all, it is a fantastic hotel with a friendly and helpful staff in the perfect location.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel and location”
Reviews.Author: travelingteacher51
Reviews.Content: I made reservations through Price Line 4 months in advance and got a great price. The regular price was good but not in my price range. I found free parking on the street for the two nights. The hotel was in a wonderful walkinglocation for many of the main sights in the city. The rooms were lovely. The clerks friendly. Only positive comments for the price. The free business center was so useful.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful staff, good location”
Reviews.Author: Capitolcrew
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Marriott Gaslamp recently for a week on a business trip. The location is great for business travelers and baseball fans - within walking distance to many restaurants, pharmacies, the convention center, Petco Park, and a trolley stop. For general tourists, the location is not is great, it's difficult to get to big San Diego sights like the beach and the San Diego Zoo. The staff was very helpful, friendly, and quick to serve. When I couldn't find the TV remote, they brought up another remote within 15 minutes. When a waiter delivered a room service dinner one evening, we got into an interesting conversation about how one of the chefs on the TV show "Hell's Kitchen" used to work at the Marriott. Since I was travelling alone and missing home, it meant a lot that this very busy employee took a couple of minutes out of his day to make me feel welcome, and I made sure to eat in the restaurant after our conversation. The room was always clean, and on a night I worked very late, I returned to find my covers turned down and cookies left by the bed. It was a small touch. but meant a lot after a 17 hour work day. Some drawbacks - as mentioned in other reviews - there is no pool. Walls are paper thin. I could hear people talking at normal volume in the hall as if they were sitting in my room, which made it difficult to sleep with people passing up and down the hall. The sound of the elevator bells could be heard clearly in my room, and I was a few doors away from the elevators. The carpets in hallways seemed dingy, and sometimes it took a couple of days for bits of trash to get picked up in the hall. The food was good at the restaurant, but there was not much of a selection. The hotel would be great for short visits, especially for those attending conventions or going to baseball games. Suggest keeping this hotel in mind, but looking at other hotels for longer stays or for trips if sightseeing is your primary reason for trip.

Reviews.Title: “Besi in class”
Reviews.Author: Chaucer39
Reviews.Content: Van not beat this for attentive staff, great room service and all around quality. One of the best

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: eemperor
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel with my 16 year old son and was very impressed with the helpfulness of the staff and cleanliness of the rooms. It was within walking distance to call the major evening attractions and shopping in the gaslamp district. . . and was close to the convention center too. I would recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a hotel in this exciting part of town.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and Friendly place to base your visit in San Diego”
Reviews.Author: Jcnewt
Reviews.Content: Great service, very friendly staff from the front desk, housekeeping, to the restaurant. I would recommend this hotel to others. Would be nice if an arrangement was made with other nearby Marriott for pool use.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific Location & Great Service”
Reviews.Author: SDFan90650
Reviews.Content: The Marriott in San Diego's Gaslamp is: new; modern; lovely designs; spacious rooms;& a perfect location for those coming from out of town to see their "home team" lose to the Padres. (I have been told by friends from Chicago, that many travel to SD to watch a ball game, & it may be less expensive to fly here, stay at this Marriott, and go to the game, than to try to get a seat at their own ball park! That's sad, but this Marriott will make them feel right at home!) The service was perfect, & each Marriott em-ee appropriately asked if we needed directions as we left the hotel. It was a refreshing visit, & I highly recommend staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Spectacular!”
Reviews.Author: gd1933
Reviews.Content: Awesome hotel - boutique feel with all the niceties of a big Marriott. Superb location close to the convention center and entertainment in the Gaslamp district. Beds were great, quiet rooms with no spill over noise from other rooms or from outside. Great rooftop bar with views into the baseball stadium.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: RIVERMAN63
Reviews.Content: This is a great Hotel. Walking distance to Petco Park, Trolly Line, Excellent Food close by, Conventioncenter 5 minute walk. The staff is very attentive. We were there for the Rock n' Roll Marathon and we were allowed to check in early and check out late -- Very accomodating folks. Gave us great directions to public transportaion, never used the car all weekend. Great club on the 22nd floor

Reviews.Title: “It does not get better then this”
Reviews.Author: bonroxie
Reviews.Content: I was in San Diego for the Rock and Roll Marathon I have stayed at this hotel in the past but i must say this time was amazing. From the second i dropped my car at the curb the stay was perfect. Quick check in, great room, the service was a 10 from everyone including the valets. the location is great. lots of pasta spots to get us ready for the run the next day. lots of shopping, and easy access to everything. love the hotel and location would go back in a second. and if you are a baseball fan hotel is right across the street from the ball park.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location in the Gaslight Quarter”
Reviews.Author: tcundell
Reviews.Content: I stayed for 2 nights over a weekend while teaching a workshop at a convention. As I flew in from the east coast arrive around 10 pm and was on business I found my originally assigned room overlooking a roof-top bar too noisy but the front deck was good enough to offer me a quieter room. The hotel room was large and well appointed Why cannot hotels show you a floor plan and help you select a suitable room. This is routinely offered when we book an airline flight?

Reviews.Title: “Great stay, love the room decor and the view, HAVE to visit the Skybar!”
Reviews.Author: pbdroste
Reviews.Content: Great place to stay! Clean and very good decor, great view of Petco Park and the Bay, The Sky Bar is DEFINITELY worth visiting whether or not you stay at this hotel. Absolutely phenomenal with outdoor heaters, fire, tvs overlooking Petco Park and the Bay, the ambiance is awesome. They even offer blankets for those with a chill. But we didn't need them. Very cool, highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location......”
Reviews.Author: Stuart J
Reviews.Content: We travelled to San Diego principally to see a concert, with the benefit of being able to explore a little on the drive from Los Angeles. I was really happy with the location of this hotel (in a cluster with the others in the Gaslamp Quarter area), being within walking distance of the core of the activities. There's so much to enjoy and experience. As many times before when travelling the US, we were fortunate to meet and share with so many great people, from being attended in the local shops to the restaurant service. Ok, it's not the cheapest place in the country...but in most cases there is value for money in the service and the quality. The hotel was very comfortable, very clean and the service from the staff was excellent. Be warned though, the roof is a great place to drink and meet but if you're anywhere on the upper floors, the sound carries!! I do consider it a little on the expensive side for what you get...but nevertheless if you want a good base to work from, with quality and comfort - it delivers. Would I go back? Yes. One or two places that stood out eats wise: Croce's Restaurant and Jazz Bar....beautiful food and great service combined with a superb atmosphere. Be prepared to pay a little bit more than the average but it's so worth it. Dicks Last Resort.....what can I say.....I've never been so comfortable with being verbally abused!! It was fantastic fun. If you don't mind playing and BEING the fool, GO!!! The entire Gaslamp Quarter for me is just full of options. Go and explore!!! (It reminded me in a way of Beale Street in Memphis...just without music from every doorway and without the BigAss Beer!!!!)

Reviews.Title: “comfort and great service”
Reviews.Author: Lsab2000
Reviews.Content: My husband and I decided to spend a weekend in San Diego and wanted to try out the Marriott Gaslamp Hotel. We were very happy with our choice . We were given a room on the 21st floor ( concierge level) with a great view and a very comfortable bed. This hotel has a trendy bar on the roof with fantastic views of the city. The staff was very friendly and helpful. We ate several meals in the hotel's restaurant "Soleil "and were very pleased, the pork chops were delicious. The only downer at this property is the parking which is $32.00 per night, we parked across the street for half that amount. We will return to this hotel and will recommend it to our friends.

Reviews.Title: “So good, I do not want to tell anyone about this Hotel.”
Reviews.Author: ancoreint
Reviews.Content: I travel over 200 nights a year and this Marriott was an unexpected surprize. the amenities were great for a City Hotel, the location was key and the staff hospitality was great. The conceirge amenities were what I would expect as a significant business traveler. The rooftop bar and lounge was amazing and the views spectacular. Again, great staff.

Reviews.Title: “Marriott Gaslamp San Diego is cutting some corners”
Reviews.Author: erparadise
Reviews.Content: Great location and the rooftop bar is great (good music, view and service). But for a Marriot in a location like this it seems like they are cutting corners with regard to service. 1. They charge you $10 to play music on the TV 2. The clock radio has terrible reception for music 3. They charge $32/day for parking Next time in San Diego, I'm going to try another hotel in the Gaslamp.

Reviews.Title: “Wasn't what I expected!!!”
Reviews.Author: Jinx223
Reviews.Content: At first the room was small and the bed sheets were totally covered eith stains and service was terrible and the staff at check in were so slow and there was one person in front of me and it took a hour to get checked in and at first they gave us the wrong room and we didn't ask for that room but other than that stuff sandiego was awsome!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: busyasabeeMichigan
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very nice, very inviting lobby. The front desk at times seemed like it could have a few more people working as it could get backed up. They managed to get two rooms together for our party with a great view. They were very nice and helpful but they got backed up. The restaurant on sight was good for dinner, we ate late (we discovered downtown San Diego pretty much shuts down on Sunday nights) and they made us feel very welcome and did not rush us out. The Sky Bar on the roof is awesome and the staff is great. They gave us blankets and we sat near a fire pit and under heated lights. The view is incredible. The fitness center is great, had alot of room and great equipment, just hope its not raining when you need to get there as it is outside near the Sky Bar. I love Marriotts and will not stay anywhere else if I can help it. This hotel was very nice and I would recommend staying here. The hotel is a little off the beaten path but was doable.

Reviews.Title: “Woefully understaffed at the front desk”
Reviews.Author: MCP5995
Reviews.Content: On two occasions during this stay I had to wait way too long for service at the front desk. 1. While checking in my business associate and I waited in a line for over 10 minutes. Only two people in front of us AND while waiting in line, other hotel personnel (clearly management) walked past us, apologized for us having to wait, and told us that it would only be a few minutes and then walked behind the desk. No, they did not come back out to help. 2. At 10 AM I came to the front desk to ask a question. Two people were on duty and while one person talked with a guest, the other worked on the computer screen and did not offer to help. I am a platinum member of Marriott and aside from these two VERY FRUSTRATING experiences, the hotel is nice and the rest of the personnel are very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great service”
Reviews.Author: ccrandall
Reviews.Content: First off, this hotel is awesome, great location, great views. The bar on the top floor is amazing and the view is unmatched. Their gym is state of the art, never seen one like it at a hotel. The location is prime for all the gaslamp has to offer. In addition to being a great hotel, I had a great experience working with the front desk, manager and accounting department to clear up some billing issues. My credit card was charged when I booked my reservation and I wanted to use some Marriott gift cards I had to pay the bill. When I checked in I was informed my card was already charged and they didn't think there was anything they could do. I did have to make about 3 calls and got bounced around a bit, but in the end, the manager and accounting dept. at the hotel reversed the charges and let me use the gift cards. They were extremely helpful and friendly and I will be staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Modern Hotel with Well-Insulated Concierge Level Rooms”
Reviews.Author: dnumgis02
Reviews.Content: Had a great stay with my girlfriend in San Diego. Despite comments from other travelers about the loud music from the rooftop bar, we did not hear anything in our concierge level room overlooking the water. In fact, we were impressed by the sound-proofing of the room. The hotel is in a great location in the Gaslamp District and we were able to walk around the area without use of a car.

Reviews.Title: “an "OK" hotel”
Reviews.Author: rnev8437
Reviews.Content: Attended a convention in April 2010 and stayed at this hotel. In my opinion, this hotel was just OK. The thing I liked best was the location - right in the middle of the Gaslamp Quarter. Plenty of restaurants, nightlife, sports and great views of San Diego bay and downtown. My criticisms of this property are with the cleanliness and maintenance of the room items, common areas and room service (food). The bed covers had dark stains in them and the coffee pot was broken. A call to the front desk quickly resolved the coffee pot issue. The room service (food) had good response time, but the food was cold and didn't taste all that great to my wife and I. We recommend the Broken Yoke restaurant, right around the corner, for breakfast. In terms of the common areas, the carpet in the hallway (19th floor) looked like it needed either a good cleaning or replacement. The internet connection offered in the room was VERY low bandwidth (56Kbps) - remember dialup? The hotel had a memo in the room stating they were updating their WiFi and apologized for the internet service.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel service! Restaraunt was...”
Reviews.Author: Travelingme28
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel service! Restaraunt was fantastic for breakfast (did not get to have dinner there). The hotel has 2 bar areas, one down by the restaurant which was fantastic, and a rooftop bar called Altitude which was amazing! I was there for work but definitely took advantage of the great location and great service of this hotel. Would highly reccommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great service”
Reviews.Author: tinamagill
Reviews.Content: We took a few days vacationa nd checked in. We were bummbed there was no pool, but the bar on the roof made up for it! It was the trendy spot to be! Hotel was very clean and staff very accomodating. The concierge was fantastic! She went out of her wway to help arrange a wine tour to temecula and car service to La Jolla. The hotel had a small hotel feel, unlike any other Marriott. Everythign in the gas lamp is just a few blocks away. Great choice, would return! PS the internet did not work well while we were there...they said they are working on it.

Reviews.Title: “What a great services we received...”
Reviews.Author: Koreansun
Reviews.Content: The rooms were great, but I wish they had mini refrigerator and microwave oven. The valet parking staff were excellent and go out of their way to make you feel special with smile on there faces. We were traveling with 11 high school senior students and they were treated with respect and all the staff's go above and beyond to make your trip enjoyable. WOW, what a great service.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional service by your hotel staff”
Reviews.Author: Westdivision
Reviews.Content: I would like to personally thank Lindsey Kehrer, Convention Services Manager, who handled our Frito-Lay West Division Summerline Meeting. She was exceptional with handling all details of our meeting, making my job easy. Although John Parker validated Marriott Gaslamp Quarter as a Pepsi Pour hotel, Lindsey followed-up and made certain that only Pepsi product was served during our meeting. This was only one of the many times Lindsey gave full attention to our meeting arrangments. I will recommend both Lindsey Kehrer and the Gaslamp Quarter to our headquarters meeting planners and to other Frito-Lay personnel who might hold meetings on the West Coast. Thank you, Suzi Jackson Frito-Lay, Inc. Product Supply and Demand Planning Plano, TX

Reviews.Title: “Boutique Marriott in The Heart of It All!”
Reviews.Author: Ilovelamp27
Reviews.Content: We had the pleasure of staying at the Marriott Gaslamp in March of 2010. This hotel, as others have mentioned, is a franchised Marriott. I am a Platinum Marriott Traveler and found what this meant, was that the hotel was a Marriott- but just BETTER. Pros: The hotel is centrally located, but away from the Train Tracks (like the Hilton). Easy to get a cab and or walk to all of the shops, waterfront and restaurants San Diego has to offer. The Altitude Lounge is not open until 5pm Monday -Friday but is a great place to sit on a warm chair on a sunny day and enjoy the view. The rooms have updated furniture, Nice bathrooms (a little small) and great bath products! Hotel Staff is nice and eager to please. Elevators are lightning fast. One of the best Platinum Arrival Gifts (Wine and Cheese) I have ever received at a hotel. Cons: Not a lot. The fitness center is a little outdated (the ellipticals are ancient) and could use personal TV's. Was pretty crowded when we were there. The breakfast the second day (Soliel @k) food was great but service was so slow we almost missed our flight! Overall, minor minor things! We hope to stay at this hotel on our next trip to San Diego. Well Done, Marriott Gaslamp!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, ambiance, and service”
Reviews.Author: purrlinda
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for one night during a visit to San Diego. My first impression when I walked in the lobby was that this was a very sleek hotel that provides a very nice ambiance. The lobby was large, and the front desk has this incredible lighting behind it. We arrived at about 1PM and they did have a room ready for us. They accommodated my high floor request that is in my Marriott profile, and they also surprised us with a junior suite upgrade. We were on the 19th floor. We were simply wowed by the stylish decor and amenities. A nice mix of elegance and modern furnishings in the room. The living room window looked out over San Diego - looking to the left was Petco Park, and to the right you could see the ocean. The duvets and linens were very soft and the bed comfortable. I loved the bathroom. The Gilchrist and Soames bath amenities were really wonderful. The location is right in the Gaslamp Quarter and in easy walking distance to the shops and night life. There is no pool here, so I wouldn't recommend it for families looking for a lot of recreation for the kids, but for those who love night life, or business travelers, or first time visiters to San Diego, this is a great place to say. The average rate seems to be about $200 per night and some people have mentioned it's expensive. It's certainly not a budget hotel, but I think it's an excellent value when you consider the quality of the hotel, the location, the style, the comfort, and the service.

Reviews.Title: “Pricey, but good locale”
Reviews.Author: trix22
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a conference and overall it was a nice stay. Very close to Petco Park, the Gaslamp district, and conference center, with plenty of shops and restaurants nearby. The negatives about the hotel is that we were right next to the elevator so we could hear it go up and down all night, I guess that's why there was a noise reduction machine in the room! It was expensive but very clean and up to date. I took in a Petco Park tour and we went to the Zoo, which was really nice. Also, the Gamlamp district was cool and trendy. A taxi to/from the airport runs $15. I would have given it a 5 if I wasn't next to the elevator and if the beds were larger and pillows more comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Gas Lamp San Diego”
Reviews.Author: JasonW5
Reviews.Content: Does not have a area for guests to wash clothes and parking cost $32 a day. Not good! But there is a rooftop bar at the Hotel and you can watch the Padres play from there.

Reviews.Title: “Very impressed”
Reviews.Author: SVO767
Reviews.Content: As a local to San Diego, we stayed at the Marriott for a "stay-cation" over a long weekend. I was quite pleased with the value we got from this hotel. 1 night, breakfast for 2, free valet and a gas card for just over $200. The room was extremely clean, very nice decor (the bathroom in particular), comfortable bed and in a great location. The staff was a little "out of it" and not as welcoming as I have experienced elsewhere. However, I would stay here again without a doubt.

Reviews.Title: “The reviews are accurate: Great place, great stay”
Reviews.Author: YYZAC
Reviews.Content: Booked the hotel through Priceline.com for $72 USD/night. ($82.13 including all taxes and fees). Arrived at San Diego International Airport at 10:30 p.m. Took the MTS (â€œCity Busâ€�), route 992 â€œAirport via Harbor Dr/Cruise Ship Term. (there is only one city bus route that serves the airport) The MTS bus stop is located under the escalators that lead to the sky bridge. Do NOT take the sky bridge to â€œground transportationâ€�, instead walk under these escalators and proceed outside. There is a clearly marked rectangular sign post with â€œMTSâ€� written on it. There is a schedule on the pole and information regarding the bus fare. The fare is $2.25 exact change (bills or coins). The bus took approximately 8 minutes to get to downtown. Get off the bus at the stop located at 4th and Broadway. (It is the LAST stop on the route and thus not hard to locate, it is located beside Horton Plaza). Walk down 4th street for approximately 10 minutes to â€œK streetâ€�. Turn left. The hotel is on the left side at number 660. Check-in was quick, less than 5 minutes. The room key is required to access the elevators. No more than a 15-30 second wait for the elevators both in the evening and the following morning. My room, 1726, was located at the far end of the hallway. The room was attractive, comfortable and impressive. The bathroom had a sliding, wood door that does not lock. Standard bath tub and shower with lots of water pressure. The bath products were quite nice and well supplied with a few extras. There is a coffee maker with stainless steel pot and Starbucks coffee products. The unit made a nice, hot, cup of coffee in the morning. Both paper cups and black, ceramic mugs were provided. No issues with cleanliness. The room had one king bed, a wardrobe that contained drawers and the T.V., a cupboard, wing chair, and large corner unit work desk with rolling chair. The windows both opened onto the street, that was relatively quiet. The view was of downtown, the convention center and the ocean in the far distance. The 17th floor allowed views over most of the surrounding buildings so that quite a grand vista was afforded. The bed was comfortable with several types of pillows and a duvet that was very warm without being too hot. The alarm clock was a bit difficult to figure out, but there are helpful instructions on a sticker on the front of the clock. The button on the telephone that was supposed to connect to â€œwake up callsâ€™ actually always connected to the hotelâ€™s messaging service and needs to be reprogrammed. The carpet was clean, the furnishing in excellent condition and the room very well maintained. Any staff I had contact with were friendly and helpful. The common areas of the hotel were modern and attractive. Bowls of salt water taffy were placed on the front desk for guests to help themselves to. The hotel is directly beside Petco Park, and across the street from the Hard Rock Hotel. The hotel is located in the Gas Lamp Historic Quarter, but more to the edges. A street or two over are where most of the restaurants, pubs and clubs are located. The light rail line (ORANGE) is within easy walking distance (3-5 minutes) as is the convention center. Parking in a private parking garage is located across the street. Overall a quality property worthy of the four stars it has received.

Reviews.Title: “great location but over priced”
Reviews.Author: cream63
Reviews.Content: great gaslamp location close to everything, disapointing view, the bay view is really a view of petco park and omni hotel and hard rock hotel with a sliver of the bay viewable. the coronado bridge did look nice at night. Warning..no rewards points when using expedia :-( The wi fi is free in lobby but waaay too much air freshener could not sit in lobby without chocking...fortunatly room didnt have too much scented air freshener, nice bed and bathroom, decent but crowded fitness center, nice view from roof top lounge, the good: great location, nice bed and bathroom, runners are a block from bay trail to go run..newer hotel so in good shape still, easy walk to gaslamp, good breakfast at mary janes cafe around corner the bad: over priced, prkg expensive, interent expensive

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded Expectation”
Reviews.Author: CountdowntoTrip
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at the Marriott Gaslamp Quarter on Christmas Day. We were very impressed with all aspects of the hotel. All the staff we encountered were so professional and friendly (Valet, Bell Boy, Front Desk, Restaurant). The room was great: clean, spacious, king sized bed, etc. The Altitude Sky Lounge on the roof was closed (in view of Christmas), but guests were able to enjoy the skyline views. The hotel is located right beside Petco Park and is walking distance to all the trendy restaurants and bars. The Gas Lamp Quarter is very interesting and pleasant. We ate breakfast at the restaurant in the morning and the food and staff were excellent!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location...walking distance to everything...Very Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: jserna20
Reviews.Content: Stayed an overnight during the holidays and used points for the stay. Great Place...Awesome roof top lounge....Altitude. Room a bit small for the 4 of us but short stay not that big of a deal. Workout room adequate and view awesome!! Walking distance to 5th Street shops and the best breakfast place...THE BROKEN YOLK....just right around the corner....don't miss it. Front desk staff knowledgeable and friendly...check out the bowls of free candy. During the season, best hotel for Padres games 1/2 block to Petco.

Reviews.Title: “Smaller room than expected but comfortable overall”
Reviews.Author: exhorizons
Reviews.Content: Having been pampered by 5 star hotels in Asia, I had to adjust my expectations for the Mariott Gaslamp. It does not come with a minifridge, bedroom slippers and shower caps are provided only upon request and there is no kettle for boiling water (tho the coffee maker in the room can double up as one). However, the beds are super comfortable, the bathroom is modern and clean and the location is excellent. As we were staying there during a week when there were freak rainstorms, hotel staff were quick to shelter us with umbrellas to the car in an attempt to keep us dry. I would stay there again if they would consider installing a minifridge!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel choice while staying in San Diego”
Reviews.Author: jayne94
Reviews.Content: I really liked the location, right near Gaslamp and East Village where there are lots of great breakfast places such as The Mission. There is a great breakfast special for $6.50 includes eggs/potatoes/bacon/toast - coffee/juice not included. The rooms - modern with great beds and especially the linens. The softest that I've encountered also great bath products offered. Also quiet. Rooftop bar - wonderful with great views. I never heard a sound. I would highly recommend staying here over the Marina Marriott which is huge and rooms need to be updated. Service - no problems at all. Definitely give this hotel a shot. You won't regret it especially if you like "boutique" smaller more personal hotels.

Reviews.Title: “A "boutique" style Marriott, Not worth the $$”
Reviews.Author: Galactus23
Reviews.Content: What's GREAT about this hotel? The location and the rooftop lounge- Both are fantastic. What about everything else- average or worse. The service, actually was poor. The front desk staff seemed uninterested in helping with anything. There appeared to be no bellman, as the entire time I was there I saw every guest have to lug their own luggage upstairs. Perhaps the worst is the elevator situation. They only had 3 working elevators. Since the roof of the hotel is a really popular lounge, they lock off one elevator for the roof each night, making paying guests wait a long, long time for an elevator to their room. I would NOT stay here ever again, but would go back to the rooftop lounge,

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place...”
Reviews.Author: RoxieB1
Reviews.Content: This hotel is completely re-done, great location, perfect area the gaslamp district, The Altitute Sky Lounge on the roof top has a viewo f the city and the ball park, even looks out to Coronado. Wouldn't stay anywhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Very decent, but expensive”
Reviews.Author: Naim00
Reviews.Content: I was attending a 5 day meeting at the convention center. This hotel is well located in the heart of the gaslamp district ( a conglomerate of tourist traps and touristic restaurants) and very short walking distance from the convention center. It is tough expensive from all means. Internet is not included, parking is over 35$ and the restaurants/bars over there are pricy. Some other co-workers got much better hotel in value for cheaper. Rooms are clean and spacious and so are the bathrooms. They urgently need to replace the old cathodic TV they have for LCD/Plasma. The mattress is not what you expect from a 300$ plus/night hotel either, I think it had springs in it. The linen was good quality. The reception is nice. Bkfast that was not included is decent but be careful: the minute you sit down they offer coffee and orange juice and then you get hit with 4$ for the OJ in addition to the fixed price menu you ordered! The servers try to be nice and helpful but for the non spanish speakers of us communicating with them can be difficult. The bars there are expensive as well: 14$ for a Gin Martini at the Latitude bar and Altitude which is the roof top one is cheaply furnished but has a nice crowd and a central bonfire, but again drinks are expensive. Finally the gym is tiny and there is no swimming pool.

Reviews.Title: “More hip than usual Marriot”
Reviews.Author: Travel_Junkie_1109
Reviews.Content: HOTEL - - Pretty new looking and more modern than your typical Marriott. - They have a concierge lounge for Platinum members. Just be advised that if you stay on concierge floor on a Fri/Sat night...expect clubbing noises from above. There is a hip bar on the roof. You don't have to wait in a line to get in as a guest though. - Love the candy at the front desk :) - No pool :( LOCATION - - Right in fun, gaslamp quarter. Lots of bars and young people around at night though. - I think valet was required. There is a parking across the street, but I am not sure if they do overnight. - Right across from Petco park. We had a full view from our room!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing!”
Reviews.Author: knittinkittin
Reviews.Content: The staff @ San Diego Marriott Gaslamp Quarter, was superb! The rooms were cozy, internet was good & the water pressure in the showers were dreamy! When I visit San Diego again, I will def. stay there!

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly situated for the business traveller or tourist.”
Reviews.Author: SaltLick
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for three days mid-October and found the rooms to be generously sized, clean and quiet. The staff was professional and courteous and the public spaces were contemporary in decor. And you can't go wrong with bowls of taffy and Necco wafers! It's right next to the baseball stadium and my wife and I enjoyed watching part of the game from the rooftop bar. Marriott Gaslamp is easy walking to shops and restaurants in the Gaslamp Quarter as well as two blocks from the Convention Center. I will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - Particularly for Padres Game”
Reviews.Author: Terri S
Reviews.Content: Although San Diego is very easily travelled, we particularly enjoyed the location of this Marriot. It's literally steps away from Petco Park, and despite other reviews, we had no trouble driving back to the hotel in baseball traffic. You do have to pay $20 a night to park (valet), but that seemed to be standard at most hotels in San Diego. The Gaslamp quarter is a great area to stay in while in San Diego and this hotel was right on the edge of the district. The front desk staff and valet staff were very helpful and the hotel was very well maintained. The bar upstairs has an amazing view, as does the gym located on the roof.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid unless you want to party late into the night - no pool”
Reviews.Author: RealCreature
Reviews.Content: Smoking partiers moved into the room next to ours so the staff moved us to a smaller room and the smokers were fined, but we received only a casual apology by security. Loud saxophone street performer played late outside our window. Carpets were stained and filthy. Showers were good, but staff did not resupply soap or shampoo. Morning coffee in the lounge ends at 8:30 AM and the coffee supply ran empty often. Staff was friendly enough at first, then seemed surly toward the end of our stay. No swimming pool.

Reviews.Title: “Solid Hotel, Best location in Gas Lamp area”
Reviews.Author: arlingtonvaresident
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a few days in the Gas Lamp area. This hotel is very solid. Perfect location, right next to Petco Park, close to airport, walking distance to everything. Don't book a rental car unless you have to, it's easier to take a $10-$15 cab ride from airport. The roof bar called "Altitude" is great on weekends as it has nice bar, DJ, and perfect view of the baseball stadium. Other things to do, hang out in La Jolla, Coronado Beach, walk over to Fred's for great mexican food, breakfast next door at Broken Yolk. For you nightlife, check out Ivy, Hard Rock, or for club people Stingaree. All within a block or two from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service”
Reviews.Author: ExperiencedTravelers
Reviews.Content: If you are going for a Padres game this is the place to stay; the hotel is about 50 feet from the outfield gate to Petco Park! We arrived at the hotel at 6:15 and, while there was tons of traffic, the valet was very nice and took the car right away. The room was nice (hint - get one as high as you can and you can see into the ballpark) and the bathroom, while not overwhelming, was clean and acceptable. When we came back from the game there was a family with a two babies next door. I asked to have the room changed. There were only two rooms left in the hotel and they moved us without objection. I was impressed with the person at the front desk's understanding and the move went without a hitch. The scene in the lobby late at night is a lot of 20-somethings waiting in a line to get on the elevator to go to the rooftop club. It was not objectionable at all, just seemed out of place. We stay in San Diego several times a year and would definately consider this hotel again. It is a bit pricy for what you get (don't forget to add in parking at $30 a night!) but overall you will not be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Free Salt Water Taffy!”
Reviews.Author: MeganG2
Reviews.Content: This hotel is amazing. Perfect location right across from Petco Park. Everything you would expect from a Marriott. Good service, clean rooms, and free taffy! The only downfall is that there is only valet parking for $30/day. Otherwise you can search for another parking garage. There also is no swimming pool!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely wonderful...”
Reviews.Author: FightOn
Reviews.Content: Let me preface by saying that as a business traveler I spent 30-35 nights a year in hotels (the majority of them Marriott's) and this particular Marriott is among the two or three most impressive hotels I have stayed at. Obviously, the location cannot be beat. It's adjacent to the Gaslamp District and Petco Park (home of the San Diego Padres), putting you in the center of downtown San Diego's attractions. There is no need to have a car as downtown attractions are all within in walking distance and many others are a short ride on the San Diego Trolley. I was staying in town for a wedding and photographs were at 2pm, the hotel without hesitation granted me an 11am check-in so I'd have time to shower and change after the drive from Los Angeles. My Marriott elite status was recognized at check-in and I was given a room on the 20th floor and access to the Concierge lounge without having to ask. My room directly overlooked the entire playing field at Petco. The room as good-sized for a downtown hotel and furnished with a nice modern flair. Now what really set this property apart were the small touches. For some these things may not matter, but for someone who travels as often as I do, they are invaluable. Mouthwash was provided in the bathroom along with a sealed loofa for use in the shower with liquid shower gel (I am not a fan of soap bars). There were also two complimentary bottles of water sitting next to the ice bucket for me. Each staff member I encuontered was friendly and seemed genuinely happy to be working at this Marriott. As an added bonus, one of the hottest bars in San Diego, Altitude, is located rooftop on the 22rd floor. Lines to gain access extended throughout the entire lobby nightly, but as a guest, you bybass the line and can go straight up to the rooftop. As busy and loud as Altitude is, I heard nothing from my room on the 20th floor. I will absolutely be back at this Marriott!

Reviews.Title: “Clean, convenient, quiet”
Reviews.Author: AHC61
Reviews.Content: Great location in the Gaslamp District. We were able to walk almost everywhere. Breathtaking view from the 24th floor roof top bar. Overlooking the Padres stadium, awesome at night!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent place for baseball trip!”
Reviews.Author: riderfan98
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in early July to see some Padres games and it was the perfect location, right beside Petco Park. We watched batting practice from the rooftop lounge, then walked across the street to see the games. But, you are paying for the location. I'm sure you can find cheaper places downtown if you not there for baseball. As well, figure in the $30 for valet parking into the cost when booking. And, there is a fitness center which we kinda saw but never used, but no pool which woulda been nice.

Reviews.Title: “Small hotel with big charm.”
Reviews.Author: piewhacket
Reviews.Content: Every year I for the last 8 years I have been showing my art at the Comic-Con convention. Initially, we always stayed at the Marriott Marina. While the Marina is a beautiful location (with a pool), I now prefer the Gaslamp. Crossing the street after the convention can be a major pain, but you are rewarded with the perks only a boutique style hotel can bring. It is so great to be welcomed back (they actually recognize you) and be able to unwind on a stunning roof top deck. They even offer blankets on chilly nights! I am not a baseball fan, but the proximity to the stadium definitely lends a good energy to this roof space. A couple years ago we were lucky enough to meet one of the managers on the first night and he constantly checked on us throughout our entire stay. We stayed on the concierge floor, which was such a huge bonus for my mom, who was able to access a cup of coffee without waiting in huge Starbucks lines elsewhere. I am crossing my fingers for a similar upgrade this year! The restaurant on the main floor is great, but often deserted with so many selections for food in the Gaslamp area. If you do stay, I would at least recommend trying the warm Krispy Cream bread pudding on a chilly night-amazing. If I had to say anything negative, it might be the small size of the rooms, but with all the other charm, no big deal.

Reviews.Title: “How to experience downtown San Diego”
Reviews.Author: travelbug0202
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I came down to San Diego for the weekend and were advised to stay at the Marriott Gaslamp, and I am glad we did. The hotel was at a very convenient location for going out downtown and its next door neighbor is PETCO Park. We ate at the restaurant, which then gave us front of the line access up to their rooftop bar, Altitude. The view was incredible, all of downtown San Diego, the Coronado bridge, and a view into the field. If youâ€™re looking to experience downtown San Diego to the fullest, this is the place to be. I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Simply Divine!”
Reviews.Author: MiaLora77
Reviews.Content: A couple of months ago I had traveled with some friends to San Diego and I've been meaning to write rave reviews for our stay at the San Diego Marriott Gaslamp Quarter. I've been to SD before, but never really stayed in their downtown area. We had stumbled across a killer deal online at the last minute and immediately booked this hotel as one of my other friends have stayed there before. So it was a total go. From the second we checked in, to the time we checked out, their service was outstanding! We were upgraded to a room on a higher floor as we had a full on view of Petco Park and was also offered complimentary breakfast from the website we booked from. Gosh, was our view awesome!! My friends and I were running late for a reservation we had so upon arriving, we only had time to check in and put our luggages in the room. However, we did not want to valet for we were afraid of being even more late. Valet was so kind enough to allow us to just park our car in the front until we headed out again. When we came back, the staff was so attentive that they even asked if we had plans for the night for they had some advise on where to go and what to do. Really kind of them! Our room was immaculate and spacious! Very clean and enough room for 3 girls to get ready in! I loved the contemporary furniture and most of all the BEDS! I've stayed in hotels that had REALLY good comfortable beds, but this Marriott by far was the BEST! The hotel is very centalized around everything in downtown. Easy to walk around and find almost everything! The only thing was when we came back to our hotel, the Padres were playing and heavy traffic was everywhere. We were in no hurry that time, so we didn't mind it at all. They have an awesome lounge area on the rooftop called Latitude. It was nice that we stayed there for we didn't have to wait in a line that wrapped around the corner. The lounge uon the rooftop isn't your typical club as it is more loungey and tasteful. The view again from up there was beautiful! Even at night! It was just nice to listen to some good music, have some drinks, and talk with your girlfriends without so much running and bumping into a crowd of people. I would definitely recommend this hotel and come back to stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Great Place”
Reviews.Author: Didojen
Reviews.Content: Loved everything about this place. The rooms were spotless, location was fantastic (within walking distance to bars/restaurants, short drive to the beaches and San Diego zoo), service was great from the minute we stepped out of the car. Only negatives I have were that the parking was valet only and there was no swimming pool. We stayed with our 6 mth old baby and we had a nice time. I think the hotel is better for young couples travelling without kids though so you can take advantage of the Gaslamp Quarters area.

Reviews.Title: “Book where you really want to stay!! Horrible Service!”
Reviews.Author: CopaSis
Reviews.Content: Had made my reservation over a month and a half in advance. I had a confirmation number being held with my credit card. Padre game and some Jazz festival was in town so the hotel decided to over book the hotel. After the front desk girl disappeared for 10 minutes and came back with a voucher to some hotel I'd never heard of on Coronado Island......we asked for a manager. He basically spent all of one minute saying too bad, your stay elsewhere is taken care of. They then gave us vouchers for cab rides that no cabbie would take to get to and from the game. (the reason we booked this hotel) The hotel they put us at had cockroaches at it and smelled worse than my grandma's attic on a hot summer day. The shower hardly worked. Want this to happen to you? DO NOT BOOK AT SAN DIEGO MARRIOTT GASLAMP QUARTER. The Hilton across the street looked really nice. Try them. If the manager of this Marriott is reading this, you should be very ashamed of yourself and your staff. I know I am not the only one that you turned away that night....as I was in line and waiting I heard many complaints about not getting rooms promised. Expect more complaints and letters coming your way then just mine.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in Gaslamp Quarters”
Reviews.Author: dbfo
Reviews.Content: We have stayed in this hotel 3 times in the last 3 years while attending the San Diego Comicon. Despite the chaos that surrounds the Comicon crowds, the staff has been just terrific each and every time. The hotel is modern and comfortable, and the only complaint is that we have never been able to obtain a mini-fridge despite reserving one months ahead of time. If the Marriott Gaslamp can provide this level of service during Comicon, I would not hesitate to stay here during less hectic months. We really like this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome location with a good value”
Reviews.Author: Travelwizard0424
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Marriott Gaslamp and had a great time. It was in a perfect location next to San Diego's PETCO park. It was pretty cool... we had drinks upstairs at their rooftop bar called Altitude. It looked right onto the field and watched part of the baseball game. The rooms were super nice and the restaurant was pretty good too. If you want a good nightlife season and good access to downtown San Diego, I would stay there. There's no pool, but our kids weren't there, so it was fine.

Reviews.Title: “This is a great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Nolababe
Reviews.Content: We went to stay at this hotel for both leisure and business actually. The hotel has a great location in a really great part of downtown san diego, within a couple of blocks of the Gaslamp area. The hotel has nice rooms that are comfortable and the staff was very helpful. The hotel has a comfortable and modern interior. When we arrived, we had a speedy check into a 14th floor room. The room was very clean, and spacious enough. The beds were comfortable, and we had no problems while staying at this particular property. The hotel has a hot bar/nightclub on the roof that his hopping at night (at least on Friday and Saturdy nights when we were there). We would stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “excellent location”
Reviews.Author: 808stays
Reviews.Content: Parking is rare and expensive downtown, so the location is key. EVERYTHING was walking distance from the hotel - great restaurants, museums, libraries, even a Ralph's grocery store (to buy drinking water for the room!) Check in service was unfortunately substandard - when i checked in, the clerk told me they ran out of keys and the bell desk would escort me to my room (my colleague had already checked in the day before). That sounded ridiculous and not secure, and when i spoke to the bell desk, he walked back to the front desk, spoke with the clerk, and magically produced my key. Also, until about 10p or so, there are LOUD train horns blaring. The train crosses the street in front of the hotel. if the train conductor is in a particular irate mood, he/she will lean on that horn for all to hear. As long as you don't plan to sleep early, the rest of the stay is very peaceful.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Southpawfam
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed here for a weekend getaway. We have stayed at many Marriott's around the world so we pretty much know what to expect from a Marriott. Although I would not describe this as a lounge hotel...it comes pretty close. Room service, restaurant service, and staff were all great...no complaints. The rooftop lounge really sets this place apart from other Marriott's. It looks down on Petco Park and is a great place to chill before your evening starts or after until late night. We even found many of the hotel employees (off duty I assume) enjoying the rooftop area. It was explained to us by one of them that this is a franchise Marriott and NOT a corporate Marriott like the larger Marina Marriott only a few blocks away...and therefore can do things a little differently. Will definitely stay here again on our next trip to San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing Special”
Reviews.Author: turtle040
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very plain . Really a no frills hotel in downtown area. The location is good if you want to be in the gas lamp district, and the breakfast was very good. WE got it at a good price, but if we had paid more, we would have been very disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Upgraded Marriott - Great Gym”
Reviews.Author: kg32
Reviews.Content: Marriott did a great job renovating this property. The valet and front desk staff were pleasant, making the check-in process quick and easy. The lobby features modern, trendy decor. I was impressed with the gym located on the rooftop which overlooks Petco Park. It features a handful of cardio machines, free weights and enough machines to get in a full workout. Our standard room was typical of renovated Marriotts. Nothing special, but tastefully decorated and comfortable. The location is close to the water and a 10 minute walk to the heart of gaslamp. A bit further than I'd like to be, but this is a quiet property. Using Priceline I got a great rate, but will look elsewhere if asked to pay the standard rate of $250+ for this property.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel and it's location”
Reviews.Author: LongIslandLisa
Reviews.Content: This location was unbeatable. It was a few blocks away from the convention center and right in the heart of the gaslamp district. When I checked into the hotel, I asked for a quiet room. They checked thru the rooms and ended up upgrading me to a junior suite. The suite was beautiful and this enhanced my stay. The bathroom was done in marble and had very nice amenities. The king sized bed was incredibly comfortable. The room was very clean. As a bonus, there was a huge bowl of chocolate kisses at the front desk that is never empty for the hotel guests. There are actually 3 candy bowls, but I only cared about the chocolate. The roof top of the hotel is the bar that has a perfect view of the ball field. On a chilly night, you can sit next to the fire pit , order a glass of wine from the bar and a plate of cheese from the kitchen. It doesn't get any better than that! I can't remember the young bartenders name but he was exceptionally nice. When I told him I was on my own that night, he bought me a glass of wine. I loved the roof top experience. It's a great way to unwind after working all day. Staying at the Gaslamp Marriot made my stay more of an adventure. It was so easy to get around. I never felt unsafe which made exploring the area even more enjoyable. There is also a free computer to use on the 6th floor. Everyone at the Gaslamp was friendy and very helpful. Later in the week, I moved to another hotel (not the Marriot) to another location downtown. Downtown has a completely different feel to it. Sadly there are many homeless people downtown. That part of the city feels very different than the Gaslamp District, even though it's only about 10 blocks away. I really missed staying at the Marriot. I would say this was my favorite Marriot hotel. I couldn't have been happier.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay”
Reviews.Author: cc41
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 nights in October for sightseeing and Patriots game. Very nice hotel, awesome location - like most 4* hotels, no free amenities - example internet use $14 for 15minutes!!! Parking is $30 with in/out. Garage directly in front of hotel is $15 day but no in/out. They do have excellent coffee in the lobby in the am and we thought the staff was very pleasant especially the valet for the 1 night we parked there. The rooftop bar is very cool in the evening. Great view but gets very club-like at night and the staff has a bit of an attitude, also predictably pricey.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded our Expectations.”
Reviews.Author: Talldarkhandsomest
Reviews.Content: We stayed for just one night using our Marriott points from our timeshare. The location is terrific, right on coronado bay and in the heart of the Gaslamp district. There were many great restaurants nearby and we had dinner at Royal Thai which was just a block away. Inexpensive, delicious and authentic. Also, when it's baseball season you could practically watch the Padres play from the rooftop bar as you look directly down onto Petco Park. The rooms are clean, moderately sized with upscale bathrooms that include marbel counter tops. The overall feel of the property is upscale and the service at check in and valet were prompt, courteous, and professional. We also used room service twice; late at night and for breakfast and each time I was frankly amazed at the speed of service--about 15 minutes. Food and presentation was very good. We did not go to the onsite restaurant but we did go to the rooftop bar which has great views and a large firepit. Located just off the rooftop bar is the gym which we glanced at--pretty good for a Marriott. Enjoy yourself and contact if you wish, this place is definitely up to snuff! PS: I travel all the time and stay at 4-5 star resorts most of the time.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and Modern”
Reviews.Author: jek134
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Marriott Gaslamp with a friend for the weekend to catch a play in San Diego. We got a room on the 16th floor with two double beds. First off, I was unimpressed with the front desk staff for both check-in and check-out. I guess I expect service with a smile. They weren't UNfriendly, but they weren't friendly either. Other than that, the service at the restaurant Soleil was very good both times we were there for breakfast. I was VERY impressed with the room. I expected the usual Marriott room, but this hotel is updated, modern and clean. The decor is more on the masculine side and very well done. I appreciated the plug-ins in the desk and the trunk/towel rack in the room. There were no towel racks in the bathroom, however, so there was no where to put wet towels or my clothes except on the toilet seat cover or the floor. I used the shampoo and conditioner and they were both fine. The beds were super comfortable. My friend even commented that she'd like to purchase the pillows online. The room was a little on the cold side, but it should be no big deal as long as you are under the covers. The view from our room was nice. It looked out over the city. We chose this hotel for its location since we took the train into the city. It was pretty much walking distance to a lot of places and totally accessible to the bus, train, trolley and taxis. You had to use your room key in the elevator to get up to your room, but almost every single time there was someone in the elevator with us. They would just ask, "What floor?" and punch our number in without us having to use our room keys. So much for security. On our second night in San Diego, we got back to the hotel at 10:15. I wanted to order room service, but the menu said dinner ended at 10:00 pm. I thought that was a little early, but I guess it saved me from gorging right before going to bed. Overall, we didn't spend much time in the room, but it was a nice hotel. I thought about coming back with my husband and kids, but they don't have a pool so I don't know if I will come back.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, weekend was noisy”
Reviews.Author: jbmWyoming
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Marriott Gaslamp for two nights at the end of a trip to San Diego visiting friends. The first night was a Saturday and the hallway noise was so loud, with people going in and out of their rooms and (I assume) back up to the bar on the roof. Typical drunk people making a lot of noise. I was supposed to get up early for a flight, but the noise made sleeping impossible and I decided at 3am to call the airline and change my flight home and stop stressing about the sleep. Gave me an extra day in San Diego. The location as others have said is great. Would be perfect for baseball. The front staff I delt with were just ok (always seemed to have their own conversations going on while they were helping me, which isn't great service), couldn't get a bellhop to help with my luggage (again talking to other workers), but the bartenders in the streetside bar were very nice and made great drinks. Rooms very comfortable; linens, mattress, etc. Nice bathroom. Good Sunday brunch. I have stayed at nicer hotels in downtown San Diego, but weekend web rate was a decent one, and I was glad I didn't pay more with the bad first night! Second night, which was a Sunday, was very quiet in the hotel. Would only stay here again with a really good rate or for Padres game due the noise and lack of attentive service.

Reviews.Title: “Modern”
Reviews.Author: DAGK
Reviews.Content: two nights at the Marriott. convenient location for cruising the gaslamp and for checking out a ball game if you're so inclined. Valet parking and check in were quick and efficient. room's have been recently renovated and had some nice touches. a pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “Better for baseball fans than for business trips”
Reviews.Author: nhunixguy
Reviews.Content: If you're in San Diego to see the Padres, this Marriott is where you want to stay. If you're here for a convention at the convention center, it's a short and pleasant walk. Beyond that, the hotel has its good and bad points. First, the good points: this hotel is at the edge of the Gaslamp district. There are endless restaurants, bars, shopping, or whatever touristy diversion you could want. Second, there's Colleen (hope I remember that right) at the front desk. If you have a problem, she'll fix it. It's also a very quiet hotel unless you have noisy neighbors like I did on 1 of 3 nights. Unlike the Hyatt, you'll never hear the trolley because it doesn't run next to the hotel and that's a good thing unless you plan on using it. There's a coffee maker, a hair dryer, and all of the usual toiletries. Hot water came up pretty fast except on the day when I got up at 4AM to catch an early flight. Then it took a few minutes for the shower to get up to temperature. Not everything was perfect and I found more problems than I would have expected in a hotel that's so highly rated here. First, realize that all of the hotel's rooms were not created equal. The first room they gave me was on the 9th floor. It looked like a basement apartment because the windows started halfway up the wall, and the glass was frosted so you couldn't see out of the room. Fortunately the windows opened far enough for me to see what they were hiding and it was a roof with some kind of equipment on it. Maybe they weren't noisy air conditioning compressors that I saw, but I didn't want to find out. I went back to the lobby and got switched to room 1701 with a view of Petco park that was just like the ones in the traveler photos here. Another problem is that you can't get to your room without using your key card in the elevator to allow access to the guest floors. It's a nice security feature but when you get into the elevator with both hands full of luggage, it's a bit silly. There's a bar on the roof that's open to the public and at night they block off one of the four elevators for roof access only. There's always a crowd in the way, the three other elevators become busier and slower than ever, etc. And this is when it's not baseball season. The roof bar looks down on the stadium so during a game this elevator situation can't be fun for guests in the lobby. I think the roof bar is probably a good reason to avoid staying on the top floor, but that's just a guess. Finally there's the high speed internet access. First you have to call downstairs. Then you have to tell them if you want wireless or an ethernet connection. After you say "Wireless", they tell you that you'll need to give your credit card number to some company that you've never heard of. And if you want to use a cable to connect, the charge can go on your bill. Once you try to use it, you go through a screen that basically says "Your only choice is 24 hours of broadband. What would you like to choose?" You have to do this every 24 hours or you can skip a day if you'd like. Upon checkout you'll discover that after you pick the 24 hour "option", you get billed for this automatically every day until you check out. One good thing is that along with the internet, you also get free domestic calls, local or long distance. I'm not sure how much people actually use the phone in their room for long distance calls, but it seems like a reasonable way to call home once you realize it's free. The system doesn't seem to be well thought out. I think they'd make more money if the rooms were $3/night more and there was free wifi, but I'm not in the hotel business. I just stay in hotels. Overall, I had a good time at the Marriott. It wasn't as nice of a hotel at the Hyatt and there were ar too many small problems, but this would be my number one pick if I was in town to see the Padres.

Reviews.Title: “Great!”
Reviews.Author: earing
